    • Method Detail

      • partition

        public double partition(Graph g,
               java.lang.Iterable<? extends Node> nodes,
               RelationshipWeighter rweight,
               java.util.List<? extends java.util.Collection<Node>> partition)
        Description copied from interface: Partitioner
        Partition the set of nodes into the specified number of blocks aiming to minimize the edge cut as specified by the RelationshipWeighter. Compared to #partition(Iterable, RelationshipWeighter), this method expects that the user has initialized the container holding the partition, given the user more choice over what containers to use. Also, it returns the edge cut of the produced partition. To specify that an edge should not be cut, its weight should be Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY. In such cases the method may produce an IllegalArgumentException if no partition could be found that satisfies the no-cut condition.
        Specified by:
        partition in interface Partitioner
        Overrides:
        partition in class HierarchicalPartitioning
        nodes - Iterable over a set of nodes. It is assumed, that no node occurs multiple times during iteration.
        rweight - RelationshipWeighter defining the strength of relationships taken into account by the partitioning algorithm.
        partition - Initialized partition container
        Returns:
        The edge cut of the produced partition
